revised_title: Cooke, Troughton, and Simms: A History of Precision Instrument Makers
tldr: This article reviews two books about the history of the scientific instrument-making firm, Cooke, Troughton, and Simms. The first book, "Instrument Makers to the World" by Anita McConnell, provides a thorough professional account of the company's history, while the second book, "William Simms, Astronomer and Instrument Maker" by Eleanor Mennim, focuses on the life of the company's co-founder, William Simms. The review highlights the differences between the two books and their approaches to the subject matter, as well as their strengths and weaknesses.
